Cloudflare is investigating issues specifically affecting authentication for the Cloudflare FedRAMP Dashboard.

incidents.name: Elevated Errors and Query Timeouts for D1 Databases and SQLite Durable Objects

incident_updates.body:
We have put in place a series of mitigations to prevent a reoccurrence of severe query timeouts for affected databases. 

This includes improvements to our watchdog logic, updates to our internal metrics, and the pre-existing / ongoing (short & medium term) improvements to D1 & Durable Objects SQL performance in these cases.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Durable Objects

incident_updates.body: We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Durable Objects

incident_updates.body: After monitoring today, we still see intermittent elevated errors and query timeouts. Multiple, in-parallel code changes are being implemented or rolling out as additional remediation.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Durable Objects

incident_updates.body: A code change was rolled out and we're monitoring throughout NAMER business hours for reduction in errors and timeouts. Additionally in parallel, we are rolling out more changes that should reduce the impact of these small fraction of errors and timeouts.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Durable Objects

incident_updates.body: One implemented fix is being rolled out across Cloudflare's network but has not yet reached locations running Durable Objects or D1. The release will progress over several more hours after which we will monitor throughout 2025-01-27 for the desired reduction in errors and timeouts.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Durable Objects

incident_updates.body: We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue. Observed errors target only a small number of Durable Objects and D1 databases (D1 errors are less than 0.1% of total requests).

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Durable Objects

incident_updates.body: Investigation identified the issue is a recurrence of https://www.cloudflarestatus.com/incidents/kzvk0c2s5fy7, whose remediation did not fully address the elevated errors and query timeouts. We are actively implementing additional fixes to address the errors and timeouts.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Durable Objects

incident_updates.body: We are continuing to investigate this issue.

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Durable Objects

incident_updates.body:
A small number of users are reporting severe increases in query latency when querying D1 databases and SQLite-backed Durable Objects. This is resulting in timeouts and/or hard errors for those queries.

We are investigating the cause and potential fixes and will provide updates with our findings.

Cloudflare is investigating connectivity issues for a subset of Magic WAN accounts that have Magic Firewall enabled: this specifically impacts traffic routed from WARP to Cloudflare Tunnel via hostname routes or Gateway egress policies with hostname selection. Our engineering team is actively working on resolving the root cause, and we will provide further updates as soon as more information is available.

incident_updates.body:
Cloudflare is investigating issues with our Support Portal. Some customers may be unable to view open cases.

Customers can still create new cases and reach us via live chat (Business and Enterprise) through the Cloudflare Dashboard or via the emergency telephone line (Enterprise).

affected_components.name: Cloudflare Sites and Services - Support Site

components.name: Support Site
components.description: Knowledge base and support ticket portal at https://support.cloudflare.com
